concise_definition: aux. 将, 会, 愿意, 应该, 过去将来时助动词

definitions.explanation_en: The past tense form of 'will', used to express future-in-the-past, hypothetical situations, or polite requests and suggestions.
definitions.explanation_cn: ‘will’ 的过去式形式，用于表达过去将来时、假设情境，或用于礼貌的请求与建议。
definitions.example_en: She said she would call me after the meeting.
definitions.example_cn: 她说她会在会议后给我打电话。

definitions.explanation_en: Used to express willingness, preference, or habitual actions in the past.
definitions.explanation_cn: 用于表达过去的意愿、偏好或习惯性行为。
definitions.example_en: When I was young, I would play outside every evening.
definitions.example_cn: 我小时候，每天晚上都会在外面玩。

definitions.explanation_en: Used in conditional sentences to indicate a possible or imagined outcome, often with 'if' clauses.
definitions.explanation_cn: 用于条件句中，表示可能或想象的结果，常与 'if' 从句连用。
definitions.example_en: I would travel the world if I had more money.
definitions.example_cn: 如果我有更多钱，我会去环游世界。

definitions.explanation_en: Used to make polite requests or offers, softening the tone compared to direct commands.
definitions.explanation_cn: 用于礼貌地提出请求或提供帮助，语气比直接命令更委婉。
definitions.example_en: Would you please pass the salt?

comparison.analysis: “Will” 表示将来时，强调确定性或意图；而 “would” 是其过去式，用于表达从过去视角看的将来、假设或非现实情况。例如：'I will go'（我将去）是现实承诺；'I would go'（我会去）则暗示条件或不确定性。
“Could” 表示能力、可能性或许可，侧重于客观可能性；而 “would” 更侧重于意愿、假设或习惯性行为。例如：'I could help you'（我有能力帮你）vs. 'I would help you'（我愿意帮你）。
“Should” 表示义务、建议或预期，带有道德或规范性色彩；而 “would” 不表达义务，仅表达意愿、假设或习惯。例如：'You should study harder'（你应该更努力学习）是劝告；'I would study harder'（我会更努力学习）是假设性表态。
